entries.text: Thank you for calling VeloFit customer support. Your call may be recorded for quality assurance. How can I help you today?
Yeah, hi. I need to return something. It's a VeloBand Pulse. I bought it like two weeks ago and it's just not working out for me.
Okay, I can help with that. Can I get your order number or the email address associated with the purchase?

Thank you. One moment while I pull up your order... Okay, I see the VeloBand Pulse you purchased. The order was placed 15 days ago. Unfortunately, our return window for electronics is 10 days. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.
What?! Are you serious? Fifteen days? I thought I had longer than that! That's ridiculous! This VeloBand Pulse is practically brand new! What am I supposed to do with it now?

I understand your frustration. I'm very sorry about that. While a full refund isn't possible due to our return policy, let me see if I can offer you a store credit as a potential solution. Would that be acceptable?
A store credit? I guess. I mean, I'd rather have my money back, but what choice do I have? This is really inconvenient.

I understand. I've checked, and I can offer you a store credit for the full purchase price of the VeloBand Pulse. It will be available for immediate use on our website or in any VeloFit store. This is a policy exception because you are beyond the return window.
Okay, fine. Just put the store credit on my account then.
Perfect. I've just applied the store credit to your account. You should see it reflected immediately when you log in to our website or app. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
No, I think that's it. Thanks. I appreciate you at least doing something for me.
You're very welcome! We value your business. Have a great day!
